an7.9:4.1: “Mendicants, the spiritual life is lived to give up and cut out these seven fetters.
an7.9:4.3: The fetters of compliance, rigidity, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
an7.9:4.9: The spiritual life is lived to give up and cut out these seven fetters.
an7.9:4.10: When a mendicant has given up the fetters of compliance, rigidity, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance—cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, exterminated them, so they are unable to arise in the future—
an7.9:4.17: they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
